subject: FW: Re: Guess they want it shared!
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Piece of cake! The boxes are pretty much ready, it requires only 
connecting the box line out to the sound card input, and sending out 
over the internet, which I have no idea how to do the soft ware 
part, but the guy that suggested seems to. 

 I'm sure that people in different locations would get different 
messages although, presumalby, the box was outputing only a single 
stream of information. 

 This is something to be excited about. It could be just weeks away.

  
 Frank-S


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Travis" <vampire2kd@...> wrote:
>
> Thats an awesome idea. imagine though its streaming live across 
cables
> throughout the states. The possibility of the audio being further
> influenced is greater Im sure. Reminds me of when a radio show was
> being done on evps people recording the show played it back later 
to
> listen again and heard messages to them during the play back and 
this
> was being reported from tons of people. So its pretty interesting 
if
> you can actually have this done, cant wait to see what happens.
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@> 
wrote:
> >
> > It's like DAH!!! Why I not think about this!? Setup an internet 
server 
> > (somehow) and connect a box to the internet to run 24/7----LIVE. 
Or
> make 
> > coordinated short tests so remote reception can be compared to
> local. It 
> > would be an easy task to make modes and bands switchable 
remotely as
> well. 
> > What about multiple boxes?
> > 
> > 
> > Just imagine, a box accessible to the world 24 hours a day, seven
> days a 
> > week! It staggers the imagination! Given the nature of the 
voices and 
> > contacts, I wouldn't be surprised if several people could access 
the
> system 
> > at the exact same time, yet all receive personal communications.
> > 
> > Guess that would create wee ripple in the darkside!!
> > 
> > I wasn't sure if the originator of the idea wanted his name out
> there, I 
> > took it off.
> > 
> > Frank-S
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > >
> > >To: "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@>
> > >Subject: Re: Guess they want it shared!
> > >Date: Thu, 02 Aug 2007 05:56:16 -0000
> > >
> > >--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-
boxes@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > There's no way I can stop making boxes, I just don't have the
> > >resuources to
> > > > supply them to everyone that wants at this time, plus trying 
ot find
> > >waay to
> > > > make the things more better. I am no engineer, and it takes a
> while to
> > > > figure things out--as with all aspects of this life.
> > > >
> > > > Frank-S
> > >
> > >Hey Frank,
> > >
> > >Its me again
> > >
> > >I haven't had much time to work on ITC lately but I'm 
interested in
> > >taking a slightly different approach using a quantum random 
number
> > >generator (unless its cost prohibitive) and computer (hoping it
> > >doesn't get fried).
> > >
> > >But... what are your thoughts on this:
> > >
> > >What if we hooked up one of your boxes to the internet for 
remote
> > >users to attempt interaction with?  Leaning on the non-locality 
theory.
> > >
> > >Couple things I'm wondering about, assuming it works:
> > >
> > >- Would the box work "better" physically present at a "high 
energy"
> > >location?  I'm refering to locations on Earth that are known to 
be
> > >high energy from lay lines, etc. "portals".
> > >- Will the recorded audio from your box be the same recorded or 
heard
> > >audio at the remote location?  Meaning will the EVP be 
recordable at
> > >your location or only the remote users location?  Or if both, 
will
> > >they match?
> > >
> > >Just some things I've been thinking about lately.  Curious what 
you
> think.
> > >
> > >Thanks,
> >
